adjective.description: Not showing emotion; having one's feelings under control.
examples: his every word seemed to be calm and controlled
she's a very controlled player and is mentally tough

adjective.description: Under the control of someone or something.
examples: the country's tightly controlled financial markets

adjective.description: (of an experiment, test, etc.) carried out under conditions that preclude error or the influence of extraneous factors.
examples: the first randomized controlled trial to study the effects of copper bracelets on rheumatoid arthritis
